title: Demand for Rugby World Cup final tickets soars as fans warned to avoid touts
text:
World Cup organisers have warned England fans in Japan to avoid black market final tickets after the Daily Telegraph discovered dozens of British touts are risking jail by selling on the streets of Tokyo.

Seats for Saturday's game were being sold just yards from the official megastore on Tuesday for £1,500 (210,011 Japanese Yen) by several known figures who are regularly seen outside train stations at Wembley and Twickenham.

They flew 6,000 miles to cash in despite reports of a zero tolerance response by police, who previously arrested three French men selling counterfeit scarfs and held them in custody for 72 hours before deporting them.

Some England fans partying in Tokyo's Shinjuku area are...
description: World Cup organisers have warned England fans in Japan to avoid black market final tickets after the Daily Telegraph discovered dozens of British touts are risking jail by selling on the streets of Tokyo.
